text.0: In light of news about possibility of a second wave of the #Covid-19 pandemic, it is important to note the dominant platforms through which misinformation on coronavirus is mostly spread in Nigeria. Read here: https://t.co/4ZGyZ37eHb #DubawaChecks
text.1: Sign up for the Dubawa Newsletter to get verified, fact-checked news straight to your email. Click the link to sign-up: https://t.co/v83r8Ksx79 #DubawaChecks #FactCheck
text.2: In what ways could the United States’ veto of Dr Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala’s appointment as Director General of the World Trade Organisation (WTO) play out? This piece explains: https://t.co/oyBiQTEtJ3 #DubawaChecks
text.3: How has Facebook's satisfaction of two opposing demands of flagging political propaganda and promoting itself as a “free marketplace of ideas” influenced the editorial content of fact-checking organisations in Nigeria? This research explains: https://t.co/PnCsMYBULH #DubawaChecks
